reporter_caption.center: IN RE REPORT ON HYLAND, 113 Ohio St.3d 1483 (2007)

caption.center: In re Report of the Commission on Continuing Legal Education: John

opinion.opinion_text:
ENTRY Miscellaneous Orders This matter originated in this court on the filing of a report by the Commission on Continuing Legal Education pursuant to Gov.Bar R. X(6)(A)(1)(b) and (A)(2)(d). The commission recommended the imposition of sanctions against certain attorneys, including the above-named respondent, for failure to comply with the provisions of Gov.Bar R. X, Attorney Continuing Legal Education, for the 2004-2005 reporting period.
On April 27, 2007, the commission filed a motion to dismiss, requesting that the recommendation that respondent be sanctioned for noncompliance with Gov.Bar R. X for the 2004-2005 reportingPage 1484 period be dismissed. Upon consideration thereof,
It is ordered by the court that the motion to dismiss is granted, and this cause is dismissed.
